byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and KATE PASTOR

abstract: Prosecutors and defense lawyers are painstakingly selecting jury for second trial of Pedro Hernandez, man accused of murdering 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979; previous prosecution was declared mistrial when jury was deadlocked after 18 days of deliberation.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors and defense lawyers are moving with caution in selecting a jury, trying to pick people who would not have preconceived notions. That has created a process the judge calls “extraordinarily long.”
snippet: Prosecutors and defense lawyers are moving with caution in selecting a jury, trying to pick people who would not have preconceived notions. That has created a process the judge calls “extraordinarily long.”...

headline.main: Retrial in Etan Patz Case Starts With a Tough Question: Who Can Sit on the Jury?
headline.print_headline: Patz Case Retrial Starts With Tough Question: Who Can Sit on Jury?
